alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 03 at 7:08PM MDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Kootenai and Shoshone Counties. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. ...The Flood Watch is replaced by a River Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Water may be over St Joe City Road, east of St. Maries to Calder. At 35.0 feet, Water will be up to Aqua Avenue in St Maries near Leeve hill and walking trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 31.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 pm PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat St Joe River St Maries 32.5 31.2 Wed 5 pm PDT 31.8 32.7 34.4 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/spokane. The next statement will be issued this evening at 715 PM PDT.
